results.title: Angler's island
results.brief_description: Trout fishing in Tasmania. Trout were released into Tasmanian streams a century ago, and anglers fish in many places with historical associations. Trout are caught, stripped and the young raised in hatcheries to re-stock streams. Shannon Rise during the caddis moth season and the lonely lakes in western Tasmania are favourite haunts for anglers.

results.title: Angle Bay
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum, Aselwood Productions and Ralph Keene
results.brief_description: Angle Bay lies on the southern shore of Milford Haven in Pembrokshire. A scenic and historical impression of this ancient land is given, and the film then reverts to the present day, for Angle Bay is now an ocean terminal and Milford Haven a deep-water harbour for oil tankers. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: Angiosperms: the flowering plants
results.brief_description: The flowering plants called angiosperms, the dominant form of terrestrial plant life, are adapted to great extremes of temperature and moisture and range geographically from the arctic zones to the tropics. Shows the structural and reproductive characteristics which distinguish them from other plants. Traces the processes of pollination, formation of seeds and fruit, seed dispersal, and plant growth.

results.title: Angi Vera
results.creator_credit: Mafilm, Objektiv Filmstudio Vallalat and Pal Gabor
results.brief_description: Stalinist Hungary, 1948. A young nurse, honest enough to criticise the conditions in the hospital where she works, is singled out by the party for political training. Gabor’s understated drama follows her transformation from a relatively naive eighteen year-old into a cool political operator, her integrity traded for a position in the Party. The film objectively critiques the years of oppressive Stalinist dogma in Hungary, leaving the viewer to draw his or her own conclusion. Based on the novel by Endre Veszi. Cast includes Veronika Pap, Erzsi Pasztor, Eva Szabo and Tamas Dunai. In Hungarian with English subtitles.

results.title: Anger at work
results.creator_credit: Oaklahoma. State Dept. of Health, International Film Bureau and Ned Huckman
results.brief_description: Explains the mechanisms of man’s personality which induces displacement of anger onto other men and impairs efficiency in everyday living. Dramatizes techniques that have been developed for handling anger, resentment and frustration

results.title: Angel exit. Sekala has to die
results.creator_credit: Jaroslav Boucek, BUC Film and Vladimir Michalek
results.brief_description: Two very different films from Czechoslovakian filmmaker Vladimir Michalek. “Angel exit” is a gritty urban drama set in a lower class milieu, an outer suburb of Prague. Mikes is a young man with a criminal record and a history of drug abuse whose girlfriend implores him to change so they may make a life together. Lukas, Mikes best friend and Kaja, another young addict, encourage Lukas to continue using. The three of them are unable to forge an existence beyond the realms of petty crime, perpetual scoring and getting high. Filmed on digital, “Angel exit” utilises the style of cinema verite, and has a pallid colour scheme that reflects the futility of its angry and abusive protagonists. “Sekala has to die” is a World War II period drama, set in a rural Czech village where two interlopers - Sekala and Zaprdek, threaten the local community. Sekala is the half brother of Oberva, a highly regarded member of the town, who is respected by their father. When Sekala’s demands press the tolerance of the locals a young blacksmith is chosen to execute Sekala and rid them of his menace. Beautifully photographed, “Sekala has to die” is a moral tale, seeped in the typical golden tones of European art house cinema.

results.title: Angel
results.creator_credit: Sharyn Prentice, Open Channel Productions and Dennis K. Smith
results.brief_description: You may not know the name Deborah Halpern, but you will certainly recognise her ceramic sculpture with its unique tiling located out the front of the National Gallery of Victoria. Hers is the story of a young ceramic sculptor with no formal training whose public profile has proliferated as the result of an unexpected major commission from one of Australia’s most prestigious art galleries. Deborah Haplpern’s art is inspired by Niki de Phalle, the ‘Art Brut’ movement and the ‘Outsider’ artists of Europe who live and work outside the mainstream gallery system. In this documentary Deborah talks intimately about the influence of these artists on her work and life. It outlines the structure of her sculpture, Angel, as well as the artistic and intellectual processes and motivation behind her work. This is a story of achievement. It is a passionate account of a two year project, the journey of a young artist and her triumphant arrival into the public art forum.

results.title: Andy Warhol and His Work
results.brief_description: This film is a fascinating insight into the man and his work as seen through his own eyes and those of his friends. As the sixties progressed Warhol became more and more involved in film making. A number of his films are classic examples of underground movie making and are valid reflections of the more extreme ends of life in late-sixties America.
